title: Bread Pizza – 2 Ways (On a Skillet or Tawa & In an Oven)

groupIngredients: crushed black pepper or black pepper powder,
chili flakes as required for sprinkling

groupInstructions: Heat a heavy tawa or pan or griddle. Spread about ½ to 1 teaspoon olive oil on it. You can even use butter instead of olive oil. Keep the flame to its lowest.
Place bread slice on it. You can keep 1 to 2 bread slices at a time depending on the size of the griddle or tawa or pan.
Lightly toast the bread from the base and then flip it.
Now quickly spread some pizza sauce on the lightly toasted side.
Top with small onion cubes. Chop all the veggies and keep it ready before you start preparing the pizza.
Then place capsicum cubes. Keep the capsicum cubes small. While adding the topping keep the flame to its lowest.
Now top with small tomato cubes. Also add some sliced olives. Both tomatoes and olives are optional and you can skip them.
Sprinkle dried herbs like oregano, basil. Also add some crushed black pepper or black pepper powder. Addition of black pepper is optional.
While adding the toppings, you can also switch off the flame if you want.
Now top with grated mozzarella cheese or pizza cheese.
Keep the flame to its lowest. Place a lid on the bread pizza.
Cook till cheese melts and the bread is toasted.
Remove with a spatula and place it on a serving plate. Sprinkle some red chili flakes or oregano if you want.
Serve Bread Pizza hot plain or accompanied with tomato ketchup or pizza sauce.
Slice the bread into two and place them in a baking tray. You can also cover the tray with aluminium foil and place the bread slices on it.
Toast the bread in a preheated oven at 200 degrees celsius for 5 to 7 minutes or more, till they are lightly toasted and golden.
You can also easily toast the bread slices in an electric toaster or on a tava/griddle. When the bread slices are lightly toasted, remove them from the oven.

instructions.groupName: Making Veggie Bread Pizza in Oven
groupInstructions: Heat the olive in a pan.
Add finely chopped garlic and saute for half a minute on a low flame. No need to brown the garlic.
Add tomatoes and saute till the tomatoes soften on a low flame.
When the tomatoes are softened and you see oil releasing from the mixture, add black pepper, dry oregano and basil. Also add salt stir well.
Then add sliced onions. Steamed corn kernels and bell peppers. Here you can also add veggies like sauteed mushrooms, baby corn, steamed potatoes, cherry tomatoes, olives.
Stir and saute for 3 to 4 minutes on a low flame. We don't need to cook the veggies. Just a light sauteing.
Keep the veggies aside.
Top the veggies on the lightly toasted bread slices.
If you want you can also spread some butter/olive oil on the bread first and then top the prepared veggies. You can also dot the veggies with tomato sauce.
Sprinkle grated cheese. Here I used the regular indian cheese like amul cheese. This cheese does not melt. But will get golden and browned.
For a melted and gooey option, better to add cheddar cheese.
For a stringy melted option, add mozzarella cheese
Place the tray back in the oven and bake at 200 degrees celsius for 5 to 7 minutes or till the cheese melts or gets light browned.
Serve veggie bread pizza with red chili flakes, oregano and tomato ketchup.

contents: Bread Pizza is a quick, instant and tasty variation of pizza recipe made on griddle or tawa or pan. The bread base mimics the pizza base with veggie toppings. Of course the taste of bread pizza is different than the original Veg Pizza. In this post I am sharing two super easy ways to make bread pizza.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20750%201125'%3E%3C/svg%3E
The recipes are easy to make for a brunch or evening snack. In fact you can easily double or triple the recipes and make for small get togethers or parties.

This recipe is one of those snacks that you can make when you get pizza cravings. You just need a fresh loaf of bread, a really good pizza sauce (I would definitely recommend a homemade Pizza Sauce) and some veggies.

Bread: You can use any variety of bread to make bread pizza like whole wheat flour bread or white bread or multi-grain bread or brown bread or wheat sandwich bread. You can even use a couple of days old bread.

Heating: Also do use a heavy tawa or pan. If you use a tawa or skillet that is not heavy, then the bread can get burnt from the bottom. Low heating is the key here as it slowly creates a nice golden crust on the base of the bread.

Base sauce: Generally pizza sauce is used to make a pizza. But in this recipe, you can use white sauce and even pesto sauce as the base sauce. The recipe uses pizza sauce. You can easily make the tomato pizza sauce at home. I have shared the recipe here – Pizza Sauce.

Toppings: For the toppings, you can use veggies of your choice. I always stick to onions, tomatoes and capsicum (bell pepper). I also like to add some olives. Sometimes I add steamed sweet corn too. You can even use baby corn, sautéed mushrooms or sautéed spinach.
Serving Suggestions: Serve bread pizza plain or accompanied with pizza sauce or tomato ketchup.
Some Real Pizza Recipes
Toasting Bread

1. Heat a heavy tawa or pan or griddle. Spread about ½ to 1 teaspoon olive oil on it. You can even use butter instead of olive oil. Keep the flame to its lowest. Do use a heavy tawa or pan or else the bread can get too much browned or burnt from the bottom. Also, keep the flame to its lowest when making the entire recipe.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20750%20422'%3E%3C/svg%3E

2. Place bread slice on it. You can keep 1 to 2 bread slices at a time depending on the size of the tawa or pan. You can use any variety of bread like white bread, whole wheat or brown bread or multi grain bread.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20750%20396'%3E%3C/svg%3E
3. Lightly toast the bread from the base and then flip it.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20750%20399'%3E%3C/svg%3E
Making Bread Pizza
4. Now quickly spread some pizza sauce on the lightly toasted side. For pizza sauce recipe, you can check here – Pizza sauce.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20750%20393'%3E%3C/svg%3E
5. Quickly top with small onion cubes. Chop all the veggies and keep it ready before you start preparing the pizza.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20750%20395'%3E%3C/svg%3E
6. Then quickly place capsicum cubes. Keep the cubes small. While adding the topping keep the flame to its lowest. you can also switch off the flame when you add toppings on the pizza.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20750%20393'%3E%3C/svg%3E

7. Now top quickly with small tomato cubes. Also, add some sliced olives. Both tomatoes and olives are optional and you can skip them. You can even add steamed corn kernels or sautéed mushrooms. Sautéed spinach can also be added.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20750%20393'%3E%3C/svg%3E

8. Sprinkle dried herbs like oregano, basil. Also add some crushed black pepper or black pepper powder. You can even add fresh basil leaves instead of dried basil. The addition of black pepper is optional. You can even use pizza seasoning instead of adding dried herbs separately.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20750%20393'%3E%3C/svg%3E
9. Now quickly top with grated mozzarella cheese or pizza cheese.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20750%20393'%3E%3C/svg%3E
10. Keep the flame to its lowest. Place a lid on the bread pizza.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20750%20393'%3E%3C/svg%3E
11. Cook till cheese melts and the bread is toasted.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20750%20394'%3E%3C/svg%3E
12. Remove with a spatula and place it on a serving plate. Sprinkle some red chili flakes or oregano if you want. Red chili flakes can be skipped also.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20750%20391'%3E%3C/svg%3E
12. Serve bread pizza hot plain or accompanied with tomato sauce or pizza sauce.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20750%201125'%3E%3C/svg%3E
This recipe post is from the archives and has been republished and updated on 26 May 2020.

Please be sure to rate the recipe in the recipe card or leave a comment below if you have made it. For more vegetarian inspirations, Sign Up for my emails or follow me on Instagram, Youtube, Facebook, Pinterest or Twitter.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20284%20284'%3E%3C/svg%3E
By Dassana Amit
Share
Like what you see?
Stay up to date with new recipes and ideas.
This is also a quick and easy recipe to make delicious vegetable bread pizza.
When you have leftover bread slices, there are many snacks you can make from them. This recipe is one of them.

The recipe is fairly easy to prepare and makes for a healthy snack if you use wheat flour bread or brown bread. It took me about 30 minutes to make these crisp veg bread pizza. The bread slices are toasted twice. So when the bread slices are getting toasted initially, you can chop the veggies and prepare the toppings.
For this recipe, you don’t need ready pizza sauce. But if you have, then you can use it.
Veggie bread pizza can be had plain or with tomato ketchup. The recipe also makes for a good snack or brunch. Skip the red chili flakes while serving to small kids.

1. Slice the bread into two and place them in a baking tray. You can also cover the tray with aluminium foil and place the bread slices on it. Toast the bread in a preheated oven at 200 degrees celsius for about 5 to 7 minutes or more, till they are lightly toasted and golden.

You can also easily toast the bread slices in an electric toaster or on a tawa or skillet. However, remember they have to be lightly toasted and browned as we will be baking them again in the oven for the cheese to melt.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20600%20400'%3E%3C/svg%3E
2. Heat 1 tablespoons olive oil in a pan.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20600%20400'%3E%3C/svg%3E
3. Add finely chopped garlic and sauté for half a minute on a low flame. No need to brown the garlic.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20600%20400'%3E%3C/svg%3E
4. Add finely chopped tomatoes and sauté till the tomatoes soften.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20600%20400'%3E%3C/svg%3E
5. Add black pepper, dry oregano and basil. Season with salt.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20600%20400'%3E%3C/svg%3E
6. Stir well.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20600%20400'%3E%3C/svg%3E
7. Then add sliced onions, steamed corn kernels and bell peppers. At this step, you can also add veggies like sautéed mushrooms, baby corn, steamed potatoes, cherry tomatoes, olives.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20600%20400'%3E%3C/svg%3E
8. Stir and sauté for 3 to 4 minutes. We don’t need to cook the veggies completely. Just a light sautéing.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20600%20400'%3E%3C/svg%3E
9. Keep the veggies aside.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20600%20400'%3E%3C/svg%3E
9. When the bread slices are lightly toasted, remove them from the oven.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20600%20400'%3E%3C/svg%3E

10. Top the veggies on the bread slices. If you want you can also spread some butter or olive oil on the bread first and then top the prepared veggies. You can also dot the veggies with pizza sauce or tomato ketchup.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20600%20400'%3E%3C/svg%3E

11. Sprinkle grated cheese. Here I used amul brand processed cheese and it does not melt. But will get golden and browned. For a melted and gooey option, better to add cheddar cheese. For a stringy melted option, add mozzarella cheese.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20600%20400'%3E%3C/svg%3E
12. Place the tray back in the oven and bake at 200 degrees celsius for 5 to 7 minutes or till the cheese melts or gets light brown.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20600%20400'%3E%3C/svg%3E
Serve veggie bread pizza with red chili flakes, oregano or tomato ketchup.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20600%20900'%3E%3C/svg%3E
Few More Tasty Bread Snacks Recipes
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20284%20284'%3E%3C/svg%3E
By Dassana Amit
Share
Like what you see?
Stay up to date with new recipes and ideas.

title: 27 Delicious Chocolate Recipes (Eggless)
contents: Collection of 27 delicious chocolate recipes – Chocolate is one ingredient that is loved by many folks including kids.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20640%20960'%3E%3C/svg%3E

Whether you like homemade chocolate cakes, ice creams, mousse, puddings, muffins or a chocolate sandwich as a sweet snack there’s a recipe in this collection that you have to try out! These easy and somewhat healthy chocolate recipes are just what you need!

For any chocolate recipe, that calls for chocolate bars, it always better to use couverture chocolate which has cocoa butter in it and has a rich taste which makes for excellent desserts and frostings.

There are different types of chocolate bars available in the market like bitter-sweet chocolate, semi-sweet chocolate, milk chocolate and white chocolate. Depending on the recipe you can substitute or use the one mentioned in the recipe.
For the cocoa powder, use any good brand of cocoa powder.
If you are a chocolate lover, then do try these chocolate recipes.
1. Eggless chocolate cake recipe – tasty chocolate cake recipe made with whole wheat flour (atta). The cake is soft and moist and can be used a base cake for various chocolate frostings.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20366'%3E%3C/svg%3E

2. Black forest cake – an eggless recipe of the classic black forest cake. To make this cake, you need an basic chocolate cake or a chocolate sponge cake. You can get the cake from outside or make your own at home. I have used my basic eggless chocolate cake made from whole wheat flour as a base for this black forest cake.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20373'%3E%3C/svg%3E

3. Eggless chocolate ice cream – easy recipe of a creamy and smooth chocolate ice cream. Does not need any ice cream maker and also you do not have to beat ice cream twice or thrice. Just make once, freeze and then enjoy.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20370'%3E%3C/svg%3E
4. Eggless chocolate brownie – an easy recipe of chocolate brownie made with whole wheat flour (atta used for making chapatis), sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder and oil.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20371'%3E%3C/svg%3E
5. Chocolate Cake made without oven – Soft, moist and delicious eggless cake made without oven and in a pressure cooker..
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20374'%3E%3C/svg%3E

6. Eggless doughnut recipe – healthy version of donuts made with whole wheat flour (atta) and are baked. in the post, I have shared chocolate glaze as well as the cinnamon+sugar sprinkle recipes too. You can choose to glaze these doughnuts with your favorite glaze recipe. In the recipe I have used ingredients which are easily available in most Indian cities and towns.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E
7. Eggless choco lava cake – easy recipe of preparing delicious eggless choco lava cake. The recipe is very simple and makes use of whole wheat flour and cocoa powder.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20374'%3E%3C/svg%3E

8. Eggless choco chip ice cream – easy recipe of a creamy, smooth choco chip ice cream. there is no ice crystal formation in this ice cream. You can make this ice cream any time and serve it whenever required.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20487%20370'%3E%3C/svg%3E

9. Chocolate chips muffins – easy eggless choc chip muffins made with whole wheat flour (atta). the crumb and texture is soft, light and so good, that no one will come to know that the muffins are eggless and made from whole wheat flour.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20371'%3E%3C/svg%3E
10. Hot Chocolate – Creamy, thick and rich Homemade Hot Chocolate made with cooking (baking) chocolate and milk.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

11. Eggless chocolate pudding – This is a 15 minute delicious chocolate pudding made with 4 ingredients. Yes, this pudding can be made very quickly. The 15 minute times includes getting the ingredients together and cooking the pudding mixture.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
12. Chocolate Chip Banana Bread –  This is a simple no fuss eggless, vegan baking recipe of making a quick sweet bread and that too with whole wheat flour.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E
13. Dalgona Coffee – The super trending Dalgona Coffee made better with different ingredient proportions.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
14. No bake chocolate biscuit cake – biscuit cake is one of the easiest and yummy cake recipe one can make. This no bake biscuit cake has chocolate in it and tastes too good.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
15. Eggless chocolate fudge recipe – quick and easy recipe of chocolate fudge with just 3 ingredients – chocolate, condensed milk and butter.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20371'%3E%3C/svg%3E

16. Chocolate sandwich – crisp and sweet sandwiches made with choco chips. This chocolate sandwich is a quick and easy to prepare sweet snack, which gets done in no time. For more sandwich recipes, you can check this collection of 40 Sandwich Recipes.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20371'%3E%3C/svg%3E
17. Eggless chocolate mousse – this mousse recipe is completely vegetarian as it also does not use any gelatine.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20373'%3E%3C/svg%3E

18. Chocolate milkshake – easy and quick recipe to prepare delicious chocolate milkshake with cocoa powder. To get the best taste, I would suggest to use a good quality cocoa powder. Both Ice cream and ice cubes are optional and you can skip them.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

19. Eggless chocolate chip cookies – soft textured and a slight chewy chocolate chip cookies made without eggs. These cookies are made from whole wheat flour or atta. The flour which we use for making rotis.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20501%20371'%3E%3C/svg%3E
20. Chocolate marzipan – soft, melt in the mouth marzipan with cashew, chocolate and coconut goodness. If you love chocolates and cashews then try these delicious chocolate marzipan.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20372'%3E%3C/svg%3E
21. Eggless banana chocolate cake – delicious, soft, crumbly and a little dense eggless banana chocolate cake.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20372'%3E%3C/svg%3E
22. Banana chocolate mousse – This is a creamy and smooth eggless mousse made with bananas and chocolate.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20369'%3E%3C/svg%3E

23. Chocolate avocado mousse – a healthy eggless and vegan mousse recipe. This is a super quick mousse as it gets done in 10 minutes. great to give a chocolate treat to yourself when you don’t have the patience to make an elaborate recipe with chocolate and yet want to have a quick chocolate goodie.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20499%20371'%3E%3C/svg%3E
24. Chocolate sandesh – a chocolate based variation of the popular cottage cheese sweet fudge from Bengal made with just 3 ingredients.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20371'%3E%3C/svg%3E

25. Chocolate modak – these modaks are prepared mainly from 3 ingredients chocolate, mawa (khoya or evaporated milk solids) and sugar. This modak recipe takes less than 30 mins to make and is simple to make during festive seasons.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20371'%3E%3C/svg%3E

26. Chocolate covered strawberries – this is one dessert that you can make at home and you don’t need to spend a lot on buying such chocolate desserts from out. You can even dip roasted dry fruits like almonds, cashews and pistachios with chocolate.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20371'%3E%3C/svg%3E
27. Chocolate banana smoothie – This is a healthy and delicious vegan chocolate banana smoothie with Thai basil.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

title: 65 Whole Wheat recipes | Tasty recipes with whole wheat flour (Chapati Atta)
contents: Collection of 65 tasty recipes made with wheat flour (chapati atta). Want to make breakfast, snack or your cakes healthier? Try any of these whole wheat recipes! From baking homemade bread to making delicious desserts, there is every recipe for you that you can make with wheat flour!
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20650%20975'%3E%3C/svg%3E
Some of the recipes in this collection are usually made with all-purpose flour (maida). But I have made them slightly healthier by replacing all-purpose flour with whole wheat flour.
Yet another plus point of a few recipes from this collection is that they are baked instead of fried. All the cakes and desserts shared are eggless and some of them are vegan too.
This is the same whole wheat flour (atta) that we use for making Roti or Poori or Parathas. I have not included all the paratha recipes in this collection but only the most popular one.

Whole wheat flour is also an ingredient that is easily available in most Indian homes. In fact for most baking recipes like Cakes, Cookies, Bread you can easily use whole wheat flour instead of all-purpose flour.

1. 100% Wheat bread recipe – a recipe to give you a really good bread with the ingredients you have at home. this is a soft bread with a light crumb. you can use any good quality atta to make this bread. I made Bombay veg sandwiches, Paneer bread rolls and Cheese chili toast with the wheat bread.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E
2. Aloo Paratha – This delicious Punjabi aloo paratha is one of the most loved breakfast at my place.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20374'%3E%3C/svg%3E

3. Whole wheat pizza dough – a simple and easy method to make a pizza dough from 100% whole wheat flour. This recipe gives a soft textured pizza base and one which is crisp from outside after getting baked. There is no denseness or chewiness felt in the pizza bread.

4. Atta dosa – an instant dosa recipe made with whole wheat flour, onion, herbs and spices. Being fans of fermented dosa, there are some instant dosa recipes too that we like e.g Instant dosa, Rava dosa, No Grind Ragi dosa, Oats dosa, Onion rava dosa. this instant atta dosa is also a favorite. Its very easy to prepare. For more tasty dosa recipes you can check this collection of 36 Dosa varieties.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
5. Missi Roti – Delicious flatbreads made with whole wheat flour, gram flour (chickpea flour) and spices.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

6. Banana bread – delicious, light and soft vegan banana bread recipe. This is by far the best banana bread That I have made and this recipe is for keeps. One of my baking success recipe. The bread was light, soft, moist and perfect for an eggless or vegan bread. few more Eggless cakes recipes on blog which are popular with cake lovers are:
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E
7. Onion Paratha – delicious whole wheat flatbreads stuffed with onions and a few spices.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

8. Chocolate cake – a simple, easy and delicious recipe of eggless whole wheat chocolate cake. Yes the cake is made from whole wheat flour. So one can have the cake and eat it too. For chocolate lovers, I have already compiled this collection of 24 Chocolate recipes.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20366'%3E%3C/svg%3E
9. Poori Recipe –  Crisp, golden and soft pooris made with whole wheat flour, salt and water.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E
10. Phulka Recipe – Roti or phulka is an unleavened flatbread that is made in almost every part of India. I am adding this recipe keeping the students and bachelors in mind.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20499%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E

11. Plain Paratha – Crisp as well as soft unleavened whole wheat flat Indian bread. Plain paratha are popular breakfast or tiffin recipe that can be served with pickle or any side veggie dish. Another variation of this flatbread is Lachha paratha.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
11. Banana cake – a one bowl cake recipe of delicious banana cake which is eggless as well as vegan. A quick and easy recipe which gives light, soft and moist cake.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20502%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E
12. Bhatura Recipe – Bhatura or Bhature is a thick leavened fried Indian bread always eaten with Chana Masala.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
13. Paneer Paratha – popular Indian flatbread made with whole wheat flour and cottage cheese stuffing.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20377'%3E%3C/svg%3E

14. Banana pancake – quick and tasty pancakes made with bananas, whole wheat flour and jaggery.  i make them similar to the Punjabi puda or whole wheat pancakes. These are soft and light pancakes and tastes really good. If you have ripe bananas at home then you can make many recipes with them like Banana sheera, Banana mousse and Banana muffins recipe. I have compiled all banana recipes made with unripe and ripe bananas in this post – 24 banana recipes.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

15. Sandwich bread recipe – a soft sandwich bread made from whole wheat flour. Since no milk product is used in the bread, the bread can be easily freezed or stored for more than a week in the refrigerator. you can make Any sandwich with it like Veg sandwich, Club sandwich or Paneer sandwich etc.

16. Pancake recipe – it is possible to make the best pancakes which are fluffy, light and soft and yet made with whole wheat flour. If you don’t believe than you must try this recipe and I guarantee you its going to be one of your favorite breakfast. These fluffy pancakes can beat an egg based pancakes hands down.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20377'%3E%3C/svg%3E
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

17. Baked aloo samosa – a healthy version of samosas which are baked and made with whole wheat flour. the texture of these baked samosas are not like the fried ones. They are crisp, flaky but you won’t get the texture that happens when Samosas are fried.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E
18. Instant Wheat appam – quick sweet appams made with whole wheat flour, bananas and jaggery. they are a healthy snack which can be had any time of the day. Can also be packed in the tiffin box.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20377'%3E%3C/svg%3E
19. Ajwain Paratha – a crisp, flaky whole wheat flatbread stuffed with ajwain (carom seeds).
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E
20. Oatmeal cookies – This is a super simple recipe of making best oatmeal raisin cookies that give crisp, crunchy and chewy cookies with a lovely cinnamon flavor.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
21. Tandoori Roti – a no oven and no tandoor method of making tandoori roti on stovetop.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20374'%3E%3C/svg%3E

22. Whole wheat momos – This veg momo recipe has no fat except some oil that is used for greasing the pan. So overall a no fat healthy veg momos recipe. the method of making these momos is similar to preparing the regular Veg momos. you can serve these veg momos with Momos chutney or with a spicy sauce like Schezwan sauce or tomato-chili sauce or Red chilli garlic chutney.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
23. Wheat Naan – This wheat flour naan recipe gives you a nicely soft textured naan which you will like.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20480%20350'%3E%3C/svg%3E
24. Wheat Pizza – healthy and delicious pizza made with wheat flour and topped with assorted veggies. Apart from this recipe, I have shared many delicious Pizza recipes like:
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
25. Pressure cooker pav recipe – Indian bread rolls also called as pav or pau. This recipe method shares how to make the pav in a pressure cooker.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20379'%3E%3C/svg%3E
26. Coconut cookies – easy and tasty eggless coconut cookies made with whole wheat flour, jaggery and desiccated coconut.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E
27. Wheat cake – an easy and delicious recipe of eggless cake made with whole wheat flour, sweetened condensed milk and butter.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20377'%3E%3C/svg%3E
28. Gulgule – Crispy and soft Indian doughnuts made with whole wheat flour, banana, sugar or jaggery and fennel seeds. A North Indian special sweet.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20378'%3E%3C/svg%3E

29. Butter naan – easy, healthy and soft whole wheat butter naans made on stovetop or tawa. You can serve these homemade soft butter naans with Dals or Curry like Dal tadka, Dal makhani, Dal bukhara, Kadai paneer, Paneer butter masala, Paneer tikka masala, Shahi paneer, Malai kofta. I have also posted few more Popular naan recipes like:
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E

30. Atta ladoo – easy and quick to prepare delicious ladoos made with whole wheat flour. atta ladoo is not only good during winters but also in the monsoons. Plus they are filling too. for more delicious ladoo recipes you can check this Collection of 26 ladoo varieties.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

31. Methi Thepla – It is made from fresh fenugreek leaves and whole-grain flours thereby making these a healthy breakfast or snack option. For this recipe, if you don’t have bajra and jowar flour at home then replace them with whole wheat flour. Another flatbread you can make with fenugreek leaves is Methi Paratha.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20374'%3E%3C/svg%3E
32. Masala Poori – spicy and tasty pooris made with whole wheat flour and spices.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

33. Atta halwa – tasty melt in the mouth halwa made with whole wheat flour. you can add dry fruits of your choice like almonds, cashews or raisins in the halwa. For more delicious halwa recipes you can check this Collection of 32 halwa varieties.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
34. Ragi Roti – These are rustic and healthy rotis made with ragi aka finger millet flour and whole wheat flour.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
35. Peas Paratha – delicious whole wheat flatbread stuffed with spiced mashed peas filling. No onion no garlic.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
36. Margherita pizza – Easy and very delicious classic margherita pizza.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20374'%3E%3C/svg%3E

37. Gurudwara Karah Prasad – one of the delicacies that is served in gurudwara as a prasad is this super delicious halwa known as kada prashad. Its everybody’s favorite sweet. kada prashad is made with four ingredients – whole wheat flour, ghee, sugar and water.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
38. Rumali Roti – I make rumali rotis with a Simplest and easiest method where the rotis are rolled thin and then cooked on a tawa. This method is suitable for a home cook.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

39. Panjiri recipe – a traditional Punjabi sweet made with whole wheat flour, sugar, ghee and dry fruits. serve this panjiri sweet anytime just as it is or with some warm milk. Panjiri stays good for many weeks at room temperature.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20374'%3E%3C/svg%3E
40. Whole Wheat Waffles – Delicious, crisp and fluffy waffles.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
41. Jaggery Roti – an easy to prepare tasty Indian flatbread made with jaggery, fennel seeds and whole wheat flour.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20370'%3E%3C/svg%3E

42. Paneer Pizza – This is a yum & delicious homemade paneer pizza made with toppings of paneer and mix veggies. The recipe shared shows how to make the pizza dough and then bake the pizza in an oven.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

43. Gingerbread cookies – Eggless gingerbread cookies are spiced, soft and firm cookies made with whole wheat flour, ginger powder, spices and kakvi (a molasses like syrup made from sugar cane juice). Can also be made with molasses or jaggery.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
44. Mooli Paratha – popular Indian whole wheat flatbread stuffed with spiced grated radish.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20501%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

45. Baked doughnuts – delicious and healthy version of donuts made with whole wheat flour and are baked. also not much sugar is used in the dough. There is a faint denseness in the texture due to the whole wheat flour, which I feel is fine for a whole wheat doughnut.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

46. Palak Poori – a delicious variation of poori made with palak or spinach. These palak poori have a beautiful green color and look good on the dining table. Other recipes you can make with Spinach are Palak Paratha or Aloo Palak Paratha.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
47. Butter cookies – crisp and tasty butter cookies made from whole wheat flour and butter. You can serve these butter cookies plain or with milk or hot chocolate or Tea or Coffee.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E

48. Wheat Nankhatai – these nankhatais are not as crumbly as the ones made with all purpose flour but they taste good. i have also added besan to give some crumbly texture. I have also posted Nankhatai recipe made with all-purpose flour.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

49. Pound cake – this rich pound cake has a slightly dense but light texture with a buttery and milky taste. I have not flavored the cake with any spice. However, you can add a bit of spice like cardamom powder or nutmeg powder.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E
50. Jeera Paratha – A quick paratha made from cumin, whole wheat flour and ghee (clarified butter).
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20374'%3E%3C/svg%3E
51. Choco lava cake – easy recipe of preparing delicious eggless choco lava cake. The recipe is very simple and makes use of whole wheat flour and cocoa powder.

52. Pita bread – this pita bread made from whole wheat flour, is soft, moist, light and has their trademark pockets. they are one of the easiest bread to make. pita bread stuffed with tahini, Hummus, Falafel and raw veggies is a snack liked by many people.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20374'%3E%3C/svg%3E
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E
53. Mangalore buns – mildly sweet fried bread made with mashed banana, flour and sugar. A specialty of Mangalore in Karnataka.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
54. Pesto Pizza – Delicious pizza made with a whole wheat pizza dough, veggies and homemade pesto sauce.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

55. Mawa cake – a rich and delicious cake made with Mawa (khoya) and whole wheat flour. mawa cake is not your everyday cake. The cake is rich, so I would suggest you to make it on special occasions or parties.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E
56. Calzone recipe – a vegetarian recipe of delicious calzone stuffed with a filling of red bell peppers, herbs and cheese. Calzone are basically folded Italian bread stuffed with veggies and cheese.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E
57. Vegetable Paratha – These are soft, healthy and delicious whole wheat parathas made with mix vegetables. A vegan recipe.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20374'%3E%3C/svg%3E
58. Orange cake – an easy, simple and no fuss recipe to make vegan and eggless orange cake. The cake has the orangish flavor with a light orange color. A soft and light cake.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20374'%3E%3C/svg%3E
59. Khasta Roti – leavened crisp and flaky flat breads made from whole wheat flour, cumin and ghee.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
60. Methi Puri – crisp, tasty and spiced puri made with whole wheat flour, fenugreek leaves and spices.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20374'%3E%3C/svg%3E

61. Dry fruits karanji – mostly Karanjis are made with all purpose flour. however, I have used whole wheat flour for this recipe. Yet the karanjis were flaky from outside and had a delicious sweet stuffing of Mawa and dry fruits.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20374'%3E%3C/svg%3E
62. Focaccia bread – focaccia is a flat Italain bread and taste best when served hot. I have made it with whole wheat flour and basil infused oil.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20376'%3E%3C/svg%3E
63. Gobi Paratha – Cauliflower paratha is unleavened whole wheat flatbread stuffed with a spiced grated cauliflower filling.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E
64. Pumpkin Bread – Easy one-bowl pumpkin bread recipe made from whole wheat flour. The recipe yields a moist pumpkin bread which is a vegan and a healthy bread.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20375'%3E%3C/svg%3E

65. Cheese breadsticks – a tasty cheesy snack made popular by the pizza joints in India. Making cheese breadsticks at home is not difficult and with a good quality yeast, you can make bread sticks tasting better than the pizza joints.
data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20500%20373'%3E%3C/svg%3E
